contracts.title: Tower Lane Culvert Remedial Works
contracts.description:
Repair and remedial works to the Tower Lane Culvert, in Fulwood, Preston.  This bridge takes the Sharoe Brook/Moss Leach Brook beneath Tower Lane.   
The work involves demolition of stonework, reinforced concrete foundations work, coffer dam work, rebuilding of stone walls, repair of stone work and fitting of new barrier rail as parapet.   The works include associated access and enabling works in building a temporary roadway, statutory approvals, and reinstatement works on completion.

contracts.title: Provision of Interim and Emergency Accommodation for Homeless Households
contracts.description:
Preston City Council (PCC) and South Ribble Borough Council (SRBC) are inviting tenders for the provision of interim and emergency accommodation for homeless households; this may include single males and females, couples or families.

The Housing Act 1996 part 7 and the Homelessness Act 2002 set out the legal responsibilities of Local Authorities (LA) in respect of homeless households. A key duty is the requirement to provide temporary accommodation to homeless households.

Emergency interim

contracts.title: Provision of Enabling Centre and Assertive Outreach Service
contracts.description:
Preston City Council (PCC) is inviting tenders for the provision of an Enabling Centre and Assertive Outreach Service to Rough Sleepers in the City of Preston.

PCC invites tenders for the provision of a service for people who are verified rough sleepers, have a history of rough sleeping or are at risk of rough sleeping or are currently street drinking.
contracts.cpv_description: Community action programme and Community health services

contracts.title: Provision of Insurance Services, incl Claims Handling Services (excl Broking Services) for Preston City Council
contracts.description:
Tenders are invited for the insurance arrangements of the Council as detailed in the tender documents for the period commencing 1 April 2017.
Cover will be awarded on the basis of the most economically advantageous terms to the Council.  Details of the contract evaluation criteria and tender response document are given within appendix 17 of the documents.

contracts.description: Preston City Council are seeking a partner, to provide services including, but not limited to: Providing a preliminary site inspection, Obtaining all building regulation consents, Obtaining a structural engineers calculation for loadings as required, Preparing a comprehensive schedule of works Preparing appropriate tender documents . contracts.title: Interior / Interpretative Designer Services for the Re-Imagining the Harris HLF Round 1 Application
contracts.description:
Preston City Council wishes to engage the services of a suitably qualified and experienced Interior/Interpretive Design Team. 

The Interior / Interpretative Designer will be appointed:

-	For the period through to submission of the First Round HLF application (closing date 30/11/2016)
-	Together with any required support during the (typically three months) period during which the application is being assessed by HLF.

contracts.title: Preston City New Market Facility
contracts.description: Preston City Council are looking for Expressions of Interest (EOI) from suitably qualified Main Contractors for the construction of a New Market Facility. All sub-contract enquiries should be made direct to potential Main Contractors.
